result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Noll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
DNA Sample to be provided, if not yet previously done.

Hearing on August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

IN ADDITION TO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas J Noll in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Bricco believes this is a good case for DTC but the defendant currently lives in Milwaukee County.  Additional statements by Atty. Bricco.  State requests cash bail.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Nicholas J Noll in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court advises the defendant to enroll in a treatment program.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

SIGNATURE BOND OF $1500.00 IS ALREADY IN PLACE, COURT INCREASED SIGNATURE BOND TO $5000.00. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
